level.heading: DEFINITIONS (ยง 27-999) When used in this chapter, the following words have the meanings ascribed: Chief Property Disposal Officer: The Chief of the District of Columbia Stategency for Surplus Property and the Chief of the Office of Contracting androcurement Surplus Property Division who is designated to oversee and managell personal property programs of the District government. Director: The Director of the Office of Contracting and Procurement (OCP) or theistrict of Columbia Chief Procurement Officer (CPO). Electronic Inventory Control System: The shared computer system and databasesed by the District of Columbia Personal Property Division and the State Agencyor Surplus Property to record transactions related to surplus property. Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949: The law approvedugust 16, 1950 to authorize a State Agency for Surplus Property to acquire andistribute to all eligible donees in the District any federal surplus property. Public agency: A federal or District department, agency, or instrumentalityhereof. Public purpose: A program carried out by a public agency which is legallyuthorized in accordance with the laws of the District of Columbia, and forhich public funds may be expended. Public purposes include, but are notimited to, programs such as conservation, economic development, education,arks and recreation, public health, and public safety.
